newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Bankoa says to study Credit Agricole offer.
newsitem.headline: Spain's Bankoa says to study Credit Agricole offer.

text.p: The board of Bankoa will today decide if it will accept an offer by France's Credit Agricole to take a controlling stake in the Spanish bank, a source at Bankoa said on Thursday.
"We have received an offer (from Credit Agricole) of a meeting aimed at presenting a friendly offer," the source said, adding that this would be for an over 50 percent stake in the bank.

Stock market watchdog CNMV today suspended trade in Bankoa shares --not traded electronically but on the open-outcry system-- after press reports that Credit Agricole was to take a majority stake in the Spanish bank.
At market prices, 100 percent of Bankoa is worth 7.3 billion pesetas, reports said.
Bankoa announced pre-tax profit of 173 million pesetas in the first quarter, versus 130 million pesetas one year earlier.
The bank has a network of 34 branches in the northern regions of Spain.
